campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our eighth Kickstarter project, and we've learnt a lot from the first seven. We have the knowledge and experience to see this project through, which we've demonstrated with our previous campaigns. There are always elements of risk to any project and we've identified the following areas that introduce the most risk and pose the biggest challenges for the project:

COMMUNICATION
––––

Kickstarter campaigns live and die by how well creators communicate with their supporters. We keep all our backers informed through weekly updates covering design, pre-production, mass production, right up to fulfilment and final delivery. We promise to keep you informed.


MANUFACTURING
––––

Drawing from our years of experience in the board game industry and all our previous campaigns, we know how to produce a high-quality game. We have been working with our manufacturer on Hand of Fate: Ordeals for more than 4 months now. They will be collaborating on the campaign and will be with us all right through to ensure every stretch goal and component change we make is checked and confirmed.


ESTIMATED DELIVERY DATE 
––––

Our estimated delivery date of November 2017 is based on the base game without any stretch goal or add-on unlocks. Should we unlock stretch goals, we will need to produce additional artwork, conduct additional playtesting, and make adjustments to other parts of the game accordingly. These could push our delivery date back depending on how much extra work is required. As part of our promise to you, we will keep everyone informed and let you know in advance of any potential delays.


SHIPPING & FULFILMENT
 ––––

Shipping will be charged after the campaign has ended. This allows us to find the best and most accurate possible combination of shipping rates and services rather than over-inflating shipping prices now "just in case". In addition, any savings we are able to find will be passed on directly to you.

For total peace of mind, we will notify everyone of the final shipping rates well in advance and encourage anyone to take advantage of our "no questions asked" refund policy (see below) if you feel the eventual shipping cost is unreasonable.


STRETCH GOALS
––––

To help avoid over-reaching, we've pre-planned all the stretch goals. They have been carefully considered and budgeted. Once funded, we'll reveal what the stretch goals will be.


ACTIVE PROJECTS
––––

We’ve run quite a few Kickstarter projects, with this being our eighth. We have Entropy: Worlds Collide and Smiths of Winterforge in active production and Skyward that is in manufacturing.

Each active project has dedicated project leads, with Smiths of Winterforge managed and developed by Table Tyrant Games. Our active projects have funds pre-allocated and are being well taken care of. We don’t anticipate them impacting our ability to delivery Hand of Fate: Ordeals.


REFUND POLICY
––––

Here at Rule & Make, we stand behind our products. So much so that we are proud to offer a “no questions asked” refund policy—right up until we start fulfilment—in order to give every backer complete peace of mind when pledging. Should you request a refund within 14 days after the campaign has ended, we will refund you the full amount, including fees. After that, it is minus Kickstarter and payment processing fees (since we cannot get these back).

As this campaign is being run in Australian Dollars (AUD), all refunds will be provided in AUD only.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

I'm sad to announce that Rule & Make is no longer financially viable, and will be shutting down. Changes to the market, as well as several unsuccessful projects, have left us in a position where we are unable to continue.
I want to thank everyone for their support along the way, and apologise for the lack of communication and timely support over the last six months.
Regarding Hand of Fate: Ordeals, there are a number of backers who are waiting on support for returned parcels or replacements. Defiant Development has kindly offered to step in and resolve these issues. We're arranging hand-over now, but if you're still waiting on anything, please email , and they will get you sorted.

This week, we've migrated over to a new pledge manager called, Kickstash.
Meet Kickstash
We've had significant number of backers contacting us about getting add-ons they've missed the first time around. Our plan is to wait until fulfilment wraps up, take stock of our inventory then offer what we have left to backers first before offering the remaining units through convention and direct sales.

Shipping Status
With exception to the Asian region backers, all other region backers who emailed us should have received something from us by now. If you haven't received a response, please consider your email lost in the shuffle. We apologise if this has happened to you and please send another support request to support@ruleandmake.com.
For Asian region backers, we're having difficulties reaching out to VFI Asia. We are working on a solution with our Chinese publishing partner. As a backup, we may instead send missing packages via our US fulfilment warehouse.

Shipping Status

campaign.story:
If you are new to Saloon Tycoon, you can mosey on down below to see what it is all about! Now is a great time to jump in and pick up the whole package - including base game KS bonuses and add-ons - all at once!
A Saloon Owner ain't nothing without a good Ranch to go home to...
... and that is why we are pleased to present this excellent expansion for our fun 3D tile laying game! We call it Saloon Tycoon: The Ranch Expansion. Develop your Ranch and raise livestock on your new Ranch board. The Ranch Expansion adds animals, new characters, new cards, new tiles, and a lot more Wild West fun for your game of Saloon Tycoon!
Click the image to see 'er bigger 'n better!
     The following assumes you know how to play Saloon Tycoon. If you don't, it is easy to learn! Scroll on down a bit for an overview of the game.
In the Ranch expansion, each player will get a new Ranch Board that fits right along side the Saloon Board. Everyone starts with a Ranch Tile on their board and a large animal pen on the board that can hold 4 animals.
 Each turn during the Income Step, you will earn 1 Ranch Point. You can gain more Ranch Points by playing some of the new Tycoon Cards that will be shuffled into the Tycoon Deck OR by discarding any Tycoon Card for 1 Ranch Point. 
Then during the Action Step you'll be able to spend your Ranch Points to buy Animals, add to your dwelling, build a bunkhouse, build Animal pens, and MORE! 
New Cow, Horse, and Water Trough meeples come with the Ranch Expansion! (designs subject to change)
Cows/Horses can be bought for 3/4 Ranch points respectively. You can hold on to 'em for points at the end of the game, or sell 'em when you need some gold! And grab a water trough or two at a cost of 5 Ranch points each for a discount on future animal purchases!
If you run out of room for animals, you can always buy an Animal Pen for 6 Ranch Points that will let you hold 2 more! 
The Bunkhouse will cost you 8 Ranch Points, but it scores you a lot of points and lets you take the best available Ranch Hand!
Having a Ranch Hand around is great, but watch out for the new Outlaw - Hawkeye Harriett. Getting 2 animals first will bring her to town, and that's going to make your future animal buying and selling less lucrative.
A new outlaw to make trouble at y'er ranch and some trusty hands to help out with all the work that needs doin'! Click on the image to see it bigger 'n better!
Each player has access to 3 Ranch Tiles that grant different bonuses if you build them by spending 10 Ranch points. There's the Trophy Room (+10 Gold), the Workshop (+5 supply cubes), and the Planning Room (draw 2 Secret Claims and keep 1). 
  And we can't forget the new Tycoon, Open Claim, and Secret Claim Cards that bring everything together!
  With simple rules but loads of new content, you'll be playing with and enjoying the new expansion in no time at all! If you are interested in the full rules, click here to read 'em now!
And if you are new to Saloon Tycoon, you can pledge for the base game as well!
Base Game Overview
In Saloon Tycoon players take turns taking one action on their turn. Most turns are fast and there isn't much down time between turns. First, you earn your income in gold based on the number of tiles in your Saloon. Then you will take an action. You may buy and build a tile by placing it on your board. Or maybe you will play a Tycoon Card to get some gold or give you more actions.  
Each turn you have the opportunity to buy supply cubes to place on your tiles. Once you have fully supplied a tile it is considered to be complete and you get that tile's bonus! Even though you normally only get one action, through card play and tile bonuses, you could accomplish an awful lot in one turn.
Each player will have some secret objectives, called Secret Claims, they are trying to accomplish. There are also common objectives available to everyone, called Open Claims. These objectives will require completing certain tiles and/or attracting certain characters to your Saloon.  
There are some influential Citizens in town as well as some unsavory Outlaws. Build and complete special tiles to attract the Citizens for additional points, but beware the Outlaws... they can make your life as a Saloon owner more difficult.  
Build tiles, attract Citizens, and complete Objectives to earn the most Reputation Points and win the game!
The Boomtown Expansions
These modular expansions were bonuses for KS backers of the base game. You can pledge for it if you don't have them.
Gold and Supply Cube Storage Boards
These optional boards were offered when Saloon Tycoon was originally funded. You can pledge for these if you don't have them.
    Group pledge pricing is available for 4 or more copies. Please contact the creator via KS messaging to inquire about pledging for multiple copies.
When we Kickstarted the base game, backers helped achieve the Boomtown expansions! We have more new modular expansions planned for backers of this campaign if we are fortunate enough to over fund. We will reveal more goals as the campaign progresses.
 *Kickstarter Exclusive in this campaign means the item will never be offered through Retail but we reserve the right to offer the item directly or through promotion outlets such as the BGG store.
 Rahdo Runs Through Saloon Tycoon
 Board to Death quick 4 minutes overview and review
Board Games with Niramas runs trough Saloon Tycoon (first video) and The Ranch Expansion (2nd video)
    We are now able to ship rewards from the USA, Canada, EU, Australia, and Asia! We know shipping can be costly, but due to our strategic partnerships we are able to keep shipping as low as possible.
Shipping prices vary by country and will be shown at pledge checkout, but here are some of the prices for the most common geographies.
Where is HUBS?
Backers of the first project may remember our HUBS system for fulfillment and wondering where it is here. We are not offering HUBS for this campaign. While HUBS worked just fine and saved backers a lot of money, the amount of work involved to pull it off was quite daunting. We believe our shipping prices for this project are very fair and hope you do too.
As with all of our campaigns, we stand behind our products 100% and if you are unhappy with the game, you may return it for a refund up to 30 days after receiving it. We appreciate you being a first adopter and your ultimate satisfaction is most important to us.
  OUR MISSION: Van Ryder Games LLC is an independently owned and operated board game publisher that seeks to publish the best thematic games in the industry by creating amazing experiences, creating lasting connections with our customer base, and producing continuous revenue and profit growth.    
Saloon Tycoon artist Agnieszka Dabrowiecka is brilliant and we could not have produced such a fantastic game without her contributions. Please visit her website for more of her great art!
https://www.artstation.com/artist/Anez
  Listen to Saloon Tycoon designer Rob Couch weekly on the Building the Game podcast!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Van Ryder Games has successfully funded and fulfilled several projects. We learn more and more with each experience. Our goal is to get the games to you, our supporters, as quickly as possible.

There are the usual risks of printing, shipping, customs, and other unintended delays, but you can be sure we will deliver the games to you as promised.

A few remarks we want to share with you regarding our approach for our projects, including this one.

1. Communication is of the utmost importance to us. Please ask any and all questions and we will answer as quickly as possible. 
2. We have planned out the goals for this project, but feel strongly about not overextending ourselves for the sake of more $. If we are so fortunate to run through our planned stretch reward offerings prior to the end of the project we will not add more on the fly. 
3. Your comments and feedback are REALLY important to us. If you have an idea, concern, or compliment, please share it with us! We can't promise to implement every idea that comes our way, but we will certainly consider each one! 
4. We pledge to keep a positive attitude regardless of the success or failure of this project. 
5. To have fun! Kickstarter projects can be stressful, but these are games and the most important thing is to have FUN!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
As the title suggests, I got word that the freight arrived last night
So this is cool. Now Quartermaster will get everything set up for shipping and we will approve the pack out. Once that happens, today I presume. The games will begin to ship. I think this should probably be a 1-2 day pick, pack, and ship effort, but because it is Friday we are likely looking at first of next week before the packages truly ship. But I'm just glad they are finally on the last leg to all of you in the US.

The good news first...
EU and Australia backers have begun receiving there games. Please have patience if you have not received yours yet, it should be on the way.
If you feel you must inquire or are concerned something is wrong with shipping, we encourage you to first contact Gamesquest (in EU) or Aetherworks (in AU) customer service department to resolve your issue. Of course we are happy to help as needed, but contacting them directly will likely be faster than us contacting them after you have contacted us.
And now the annoying news...

Sorry for the lack of a clever post title. Here is the latest on all the info we have as far as shipping goes.
Australia - Ranch has finally appeared on the Aetherworks Facebook update and it sounds like they will be packing and shipping this week. Sorry for the bit of a wait, but we appreciate your patience!
EU - I have been seeing reports of folks in the EU getting their tracking info and even a few reports of receiving the game! This is great news and hopefully the EU will be filled with great ranches and saloons soon!

Here is the current information we have on shipping...
Asia - this shipping has been completed and Asia region backers should have received their rewards by now or if not, should be receiving them any day now.
Australia - Apparently Aetherworks got a bit backed up with fulfilling some really high volume projects (CMON man!) and so even though the games have been there for a while... fulfillment hasn't started. The latest info we have is that processing will begin next week - not sure if that includes shipping but at least it is something. Apologies for the delay but it is really beyond our control. Just a bit of unfortunate timing. We appreciate your continued patience.

Hi all, 
Just a quick update to let you know all of the dates from the last update are holding true at this point. Asia backers have already begun receiving the game, Australia shipments should be going out real soon (follow Aetherworks on FB for their updates), and EU (Feb 1 port date) and USA (Feb 14 port date) estimates are still accurate. Should be a fun time over the next month or so while we get yall's Ranch to you!

campaign.story:
Thank you everyone! If you would like to reach us after the campaign has concluded, we are at twolanternsgames@gmail.com and twolanternsgames.com. Kaleen and I have taken distribution back into our own hands, so we'd be happy to respond to any inquiries regarding Morels, Morels Foray, or Agility, be it general questions or about bringing Two Lanterns games into your home or friendly local game store. Whether you are a Kickstarter backer or decide to pick up a copy after the official launch in November 2017, we wish you good health and happy foraging!
Thanks for checking out Morels Foray! If you're new to the game, we hope you dig it, and if you're already a fan of Morels, we hope you enjoy the new strategic and social dimensions of Foray (note: Foray does require the Morels base game).
+ Morels Foray expands Morels with cards featuring new characters, items, events, and weather that vary how you interact with the forest and with your opponent(s). In the graphic below, you can check out how the cards work as well as Vince Dorse's ever enchanting art.  The creative process is ongoing with the aim to finish illustrations around May 10th (the 5th Anniversary of Morels). I always feel like a kid opening a brown paper package tied up with string when Vince sends over something new. It'll be exciting to share these art updates with you as we go.
+ Morels Foray enables you to play Morels with 2-4 players. Below you'll find turn examples demonstrating how each system is unique. 2 player remains at the 30 minute mark for gameplay, as does 3 player, with 4 players at 30-45 minutes. We design quick games and firmly believe in begging for a rematch rather than praying for an ending.
+ A limited number of handcrafted pieces are available! They include the original Morels sticks and pans as well as a carved mushroom and wooden tokens tailored to Foray, which are Kickstarter exclusive. There's a process graphic for each showing how I make them.
The summaries below should provide a good sense of how the new cards work.  If you'd like to peruse the full (beta) rulebook, it is available on Board Game Geek.
The new Foray cards can also be used with 3p and 4p.  We've had a fantastic time with these, both the different tactical approaches and the enhanced social component. Lots of laughter, not originally a design goal but a wonderful bonus.
Against the better judgement of my primary care physician, I'm making more sticks and pans. I was touched with how the game community responded to these back in 2012 and couldn't resist making more for Morels players who have come on board along the way.  There's something compelling to me about craftsmanship in board gaming, both the creation of the pieces and the resulting tactile element of play. 
Of course we had to bring Foray into the handcrafted fun! Given the need for a Priority Marker in 4p and a 1st Player Marker in 3p, the notion of a "mushroom miniature" emerged. Enter the tagua nut! Sculpting it is like trying to mold Valyrian Steel that was tempered in Mt Doom then frozen in an icy chasm of the Frostfangs for 500 years, but boy do they turn out beautiful.  4p also uses "Player Ready" Markers, and getting some wood into the game was a must: laser engraved wooden nickels featuring the Fairy Ring, Shiitake, Porcini, and Destroying Angel.   Kaleen asked me "Are you sure someone in any given group of 4 will want to be the Destroying Angel?" Which in my mind is somewhat akin to asking if people will be into a 1920's alternate history theme featuring heavily armed mechs, farming, and pet tigers. Yes, yes they will :)
Which bring us to Stretch Goals!  
4/18 2:00PM CT: The mushroom meeples (I'm nominating "fungles"...suggestions?) WILL be the Compass dials used in 4p, so there will be 4x of those in the box in varying colors, plus one for the Priority Marker. 
4/18 7:30PM CT: Blank designer cards! You can create new actions or mushrooms for your game and even share them with the community. 
4/19 ~The Witching Hour CT: Golden mushroom! The Priority Player Marker will now be golden with a metallic sheen, continuing the pervasive theme of mushrooms as treasure throughout Morels Foray (see Thief and eventually Eureka). When foraging, that is exactly what it feels like, the lure of the hunt and the thrill of discovery.  Sometimes when I find a flush I have to double or triple take...as if wait a minute, are these really here, no one's found these, they're mine, all mine? Sweet Sicilian saffron we're eating well tonight! 
4/19 4:45PM CT Digital Designer Blanks: I'll send the psd (or format of your choice, but psd will be layered for easier use) blanks of the day card back/front and night card back/front to any KS backer who would like to have a go designing their own expansion mushrooms, items, characters, etc digitally (Photoshop being the most common).  The physical cards will work great, but if you want to go all out with unlimited options and a professional look, this option enables it.  Heck, put yourself into the game!
4/20 2:00PM CT Mushroom Paper Score Sheet: Kaleen and I based this idea on our friends Aubrey and Ryan, who created a "Brag Board" to track their 2p gaming.  Turns out one thought they won more, the other thought the same, so they met at High Noon on the Brag Board.  Kaleen will be making these, incorporating mushrooms into the paper somehow (pulp or spore print or mushroom ink; not sure quite yet...she'll start working on these over the summer), 1 sheet per backer.
4/22 5:00PM CT Morchella descends upon us!!! Vince and I did some juggling. I'm going to take the Map card, which I'm pumped about, and he agreed to do the dragon. Map will be done on ink and parchment in style of LOTR maps, dragon will be a clear homage to Smaug, so it's a double-Tolkien day! These games would likely not exist without his influence, both for hobbit love of mushrooms and for the sense of quest and completion those books instilled to my vision on one side and work ethic on the other.
4/26 2:00AM CT Travel/Bits Bag!  Kaleen will have her work cut out for her.  They will be simple but useful, likely muslin or cotton cloth, with a drawstring, stamped with a couple of morels.  It's intent is to hold the cards plus any tokens or bits for ease of storage (probably bits only) or travel (cards + bits). 
5/8 5:00PM CT Solo variant upgrade! BGG's GameRulesforOne created a sweet solo variant for the original Morels.  He's graciously picked up the gauntlet to Foray with the solo ruleset.  We've had fun collaborating on playtesting and rule modification over the last month. With the unlocked stretch goal, we will continue working to optimize Morels + Foray soloplay and I will be creating a downloadable rulebook in the same style as the print rulebook, complete with extensive graphic examples.  When complete, it will be available as a downloadable PDF on the Two Lanterns website as well as on the Morels Foray "files" page at Board Game Geek.
5/9 2:00 AM CT A Solo Tournament (Global) will be held in Spring, 2018! This will be a one week tournament where any KS backer can participate and post scores on BGG (or email them to me and I'll post if you don't have a BGG account). Format is similar to some track meet events, with three attempts for a top score across three different game setups (thus, 9 maximum plays).  Rules will be released shortly before the tournament.  A minibadge will be made available to all participants and prizes (small but fun) will be awarded to the victors. 
If you do decide to support Morels Foray, we wanted to make everything from our catalog available to customize the order to your taste. Agility is here, which I'm delighted to report was nominated for the 2016 Best 2-Player Golden Geek just like its big brother, as well as additional copies of Morels and Morels Foray for friends or family.  
We've made a habit of printing up amusing t-shirts to complement our games.  I love wearing these and seeing the reactions from mushroom, dog, or game lovers when their eyes light up.
There is a set of 6 pans in the event you have the original Morels Handcrafted Pieces (16 sticks and 2 pans) but would like additional pans to equip all of the 2-4 players in Morels Foray with two HC starting pans rather than using punchboard tokens.
Given the early sellout of the Morels Foray Handcrafted Pieces (mushroom mini and 4 wooden tokens), we've made the wooden tokens from that set available also.  Won't be able to make any more mushroom minis than those already promised to the pledges, but happy to offer this piece of that pie should it interest.
If picking up any add-ons, simply increase your pledge by that amount (shirts, pan extension, and wooden tokens ship free internationally with package; please add $5 shipping per international game to the add-on amount). On the Kickstarter survey at the end of the campaign, you'll be able to note which item(s) you would like and they will ship free with your package in the US or $5 per game internationally .
New to Morels? Check out one of the video reviews that posted following the game's debut at 2012 Origins, Gen-Con, or BGG.con!
Joel Eddy's thoughts over at Drive-Thru Review:
Vintage Rahdo (only his 19th review) from the glass-table era! Makes for a trippy floating forest. Church bells in background are a nice Easter Egg (Rahdo, aka Richard Ham, lives in Malta, where apparently churches outnumber homes like sheep to people in New Zealand from the sound of this video).  This is a full game run-through:
Retail options are available!  There are three different bundles to choose from (brick and mortar sales only, please):
5x Morels + 5x Morels Foray
10x Morels Foray
10x Morels + 10x Morels Foray
Carton size is 20, hence the 5x and 10x case quantities. If interested, please send me a message and I will quote prices. Shipping free in the US for all three options.  We love partnering with FLGSs!
Shipping is free to the US and subsidized to the rest of the world. We would love to have offered zone specific friendly shipping, but with the added complication of handcrafted pieces and differing sources for those vs the game, it just wasn't feasible.  Please note that we are not able to sell the Morels base game to Europe, South America, or China due to licensing agreements.
Q1: If I'm pledging at a level that includes Morels Handcrafted pieces, do I need the $5 add-on for the extra 6 pans?  
A1: You don't! All of these Morels HC sets come with 16 sticks and 8 pans, enough to support 2-4p Morels Foray. The add-on would just be for folks who acquired Morels HC bits back in 2012-13, which came with 2 pans. The 6 pans in the add-on would bring their total up to 8.
Q2: Is Morels Foray compatible with "Fungi"?  
A2: It isn't. We're working with Pegasus Spiele in hopes that the expansion may be ported over to the European cousin of Morels. We'll share any news as it develops.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As long as everyone stays healthy, ships float, and machinery whirrs, we don't anticipate standard challenges beyond those that we have already embraced with Morels and Agility. One unique challenge will be keeping my hands in tact and unkindled while sawing, sanding, and polishing the custom pieces! Many enjoyable hours of work, much of that time with my fingers about 6 mm from a band-saw or rotary-saw blade at several thousand RPM. So far, so good!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Nearly in your home!  Internationals mail today and US next week, hopefully by the 17th-20th. I enjoy cooking now and then, and when I do take to the kitchen my supreme goal (sorry, taste!) is to have everything done at the same time. Multiple timers going off simultaneously is a sublime simple joy..similar concept here. Ideally everyone will receive their packages in the same week (of course it won't happen as internationals are unpredictable and vary by country, but nice to have a goal!). 
Thought I'd give you a glimpse of a fraction of what's been happening as told in pictures and stats.  Basically, since the KS wrapped up in May, I've been a one man Morels band 40-80 hours a week.  A few numbers to put the madness into perspective:

updates.update_userinfo: On pace, thumb in tact, and I must be nuts!
updates.update_content: Since 2011, I've carved ~30,000 foraging sticks (!) and now about 300 tagua nut mushrooms, all working with my hands cm or even mm from steel teeth gnashing through the air like famished wolves come upon an Arctic feast. The first near-calamity happened on Sunday. Got too comfortable with my tools and more than too invested in a "Hardcore History" podcast and nearly lost my right thumb. The savior: a pair of $14 cut-resistant gloves from the clearance rack at Menard's. Wasn't sure if they'd actually work, but this was trial by fire, as it were, and did they ever! The rotary blade was spinning at a humbling 15,000 rpm and the contact was firm. Expecting to be ER-bound, I inspected and all that remains is a haunting memory and one tiny brown thread loosed from the thick nitrile armor of the glove. Best $14 I ever spent.

Short story: We are on time so far! Pieces are churning and manufacturing is buzzing. Project delivery date of November looks entirely doable, pending the ever fearful threshold of customs. It's been a while, so just wanted to get in touch with the town crier a'singin' "all's well" from the ramparts. Hope this finds you well, too!
Long story: My days are measured in foraging sticks :)  With such a mountain to climb, the goal is steady, albeit incremental gain. I can't say the summit is in view, but the air is thinning and the invigorating smell of sun baked pine abounds. This is only part metaphor. I mostly work in the shade of the driveway, enjoying the cool northern breezes that temper even a genuinely warm summer day. When it does top 80 or even 85 (gasp!) in mid-afternoon, those breezes cradle the scent of baking spruce needles from two beds about 10 ft distant, one in ours and one in our neighbor's yard. I'm generally "reading" (ie being read to, as profound a joy now as it must have been at 3) fantasy lit or watching an occasional documentary while making the foraging sticks or mushroom minis. The result is a mind-meld of the fantasy landscape in which I'm immersed and olfactory teleportation, compliments of the baking spruce needles, to the inimitable Sierra Nevada. I worked a glorious winter during my rambling twenties at a ski school in Tahoe and some of my happiest backpacking has been in and around Sequoia and Kings Canyon NPs, so in a word, this recipe of woodworking, literature, and subconscious travel through both space and time is sublime. I have you all to thank for enabling and hope you enjoy the fruits of the work!

Hi all! A quick update to share that I spoke with the manufacturer and the timeline is set for November delivery. Of course there could be hiccups along the way (customs is always the cross-your-fingers moment), but in the past it's gone smoothly, so hopefully history repeats. 
Thanks to all who have completed surveys! There are still about 100 outstanding. It's a great help to have those done asap, so if incomplete, please take a moment to fill it out when you can. Into the final hours! One clarification since it's come up with the new levels: ALL $19+ PLEDGE LEVELS RECEIVE ALL STRETCH GOALS. I added "+stretch goals" to the new 2018 levels because some folks had wondered about that in the original levels. At the time I wasn't worried because the original levels were all sold out, but now that a few have come available with pledge shifting it's caused some confusion.  Sorry about that!
We are ambitiously trying to submit all final print files by Friday.  I just went through the rulebook for about the fortieth time and uploaded the beta (v2) PDF to our website.  At this point, I'm worried it's one of the those times when I'm so close to it that I may not be able to see the forest for the trees. If anyone would be willing to read it over and share any suggested edits (grammar, spelling, clarity, or tone) via email to twolanternsgames@gmail.com, it would be a huge help and I'll send heaps of positive foraging karma your way.  Future opponents beware!

campaign.story:
If you missed out visit: https://buttonshygames.com/collections/april-games to pre-order any/all of the games and free stretch goals.
 Each player in Circle the Wagons is fixin' to build up their own boomtown, but only one'll build the best in the West!
Blaze a trail by draftin' cards 'round the circle and placin' 'em in yer town, tryin' to connect matchin' territories to score prosperity points! But don't forget about them three bonus cards in the center of the circle that can score ya even more points — that is, if ya play yer cards right. With darn near five thousand unique ways to score and millions of draftin' and placin' combos, you'll never build the same town twice!
       Circle the Wagons is a two player game designed by Steven Aramini (Yardmaster), Danny Devine (Mob Town) and Paul Kluka with art by Beth Sobel (Viticulture, Lanterns: The Harvest Festival). Gameplay lasts about 20 minutes and is recommended for ages 10 and up.
The game consists of:
-18 Cards
-Fold Out Full Color Rules
-Wallet Packaging
This is part of our Wallet Line and will be packaged in a small vinyl wallet, perfect for taking it on the go. It's pocket-sized, portable and protective... and has proven itself with our growing line of wallet games.
Circle the Wagons was originally entered into the 2016 Button Shy Wallet Game Design Contest and took the top spot over 72 other games including Mint Julep and That Snow Moon from this campaign, Turbo Drift and Find Your Seats from our last campaign, and many many other great games. 
  Print and Play (original prototype, no art) | Prototype Rules 
You can print the full game right here. It's only 4 pages long with front and back sides of the cards. The rules are just another few pages, and you can even make it work by just viewing them online.
Please note: The rules on all of the games are NOT final. They still need to go through editing and graphic design, but any notes that you have at this point are incredibly appreciated.
So we're going to start this off with my review. Yes I'm the publisher and there's an assumed bias there, but as someone who has released 24 of these wallet card games in the past, and has received dozens and dozens of submissions, I have to say that Circle The Wagons is the best microgame I have ever played. The designers used the small size in a way that no other game has done. But size aside, it's one of my favorite games. Why? It's the simple elegance of how the items, the background locations and scoring conditions interact. Each game only uses 3 out of 18 scoring conditions, so every single game is very different from the last. It hits all the right spots. 
Now onto the real reviewers. :)
Eric Buscemi, The Cardboard Hoard - "It is the best game I have played in Button Shy's line, and this line features other games I think very highly of, such as Ahead in the Clouds and Pentaquark. Highest possible recommendation."
Andrew Fisher, Gamosity - "Simply put, Circle The Wagons belongs in your collection…If you’ve got someone to play with, a table to use, and 15 minutes to kill, Circle The Wagons is going to be a perfect fit." (LINK) 
Eric Booth, What Did You Play This Week - "Final verdict? I give this two rootin' tootin', beer bottle shootin', hollerin' and a hootin', thumbs up." (LINK)
Andy Matthews, Meeple Mountain - "Equal parts Patchwork, Isle of Skye, and Kingdom Builder, Circle the Wagons is the quintessential big game in a small package. Meaty, beautiful, streamlined, and pure fun to play." (LINK)
Samantha Fisher, GeekDad/GeekMom - "Circle the Wagons was a rip roarin' success with cowpokes long and short at my house. With rules simple enough to only take one walk through but strategy just complex enough to hold up through multiple playthroughs I definitely see a place for this in my Short but Sweet games list. It is perfect for getting warmed up for a game night, sneaking in a quick game while waiting for your food in a restaurant, or anytime you have 15 minutes to spare."
        Also included in this campaign are TWO MORE BRAND NEW GAMES! Mint Julep by Dan Letzring (Dino Dude Ranch, Gadgeteers) and That Snow Moon by Dave Chalker (Get Bit!, Thief's Market). Both are available here for the first time (and at reduced prices too!)
Mint Julep - A 2-4 player horse racing/betting game.

Print and Play | Prototype Rules
In Mint Julep, players draft cards, place bets and then manipulate the race in order to ensure the horse that they want to win ends up finishing the race in a top spot. Be careful where you place your bet because the odds might be against you!
Each game is played in 3 Rounds that each consist of three phases: 1.) drafting cards for your hand 2.) betting on which horse you think will win 3.) playing movement cards to adjust the order of the horses in the race.
Final scoring is based on where horses start in the race (horses starting in lower positions are worth more points), where horses end in the race (more points earned for higher place finishers), and when a bet was played (with later bets being worth less than earlier bets).
Score the highest points with your bet and you win!
That Snow Moon - A 2-4 player asymmetrical card throwing game.
Print and Play (black and white | Prototype Rules
That Snow Moon is a space opera inspired by a popular movie involving space and battles, while not actually infringing upon intellectual property.
In the game, players divide into two teams: Liberation and Dynasty. Liberation throws their cards facedown onto the field, trying to assemble a particular set of cards. The Dynasty drops their cards onto the table, trying to land on the Liberation cards to reveal them and take out important cards from the Liberation.
The Liberation tries to bluff and disguise what they're doing, while the Dynasty tries to outguess and crush them, which each side uses its unique special abilities as best it can.
Never forget that snow moon: it's a space station.
Wagon Wheels - A 2 player game about building an EVEN SMALLER boomtown.
Wagon Wheels is a nano-sized game by Nat Levan, based on Circle The Wagons. Nat has been making these Nanodaptions (trademark!) of our already small wallet games, where he will distill the essence of the gameplay down to just a few cards and tokens. Wagon Wheels is just 3 cards, which includes 4 different maps and one rules card.

In the game, two players will place and move their tokens around the map, trying to get the majority of their tokens in a quadrant to score that quadrant's special bonus as well as trying to get the east and west spaces on the map for additional points.
See below for each of the reward levels. Note: These prices are discounted for the campaign. 
ADD-ONS
And we have a few ADD-ONS this time, including the brand new games from our January campaign that are shipping now. These prices include US and CANADA shipping. International backers, please contact us to determine your shipping cost for add-ons. 
WHAT IS THE BOARD GAME OF THE MONTH CLUB?
We have an awesome following of repeat customers. As a result, we've built the Board Game of the Month Club, a subscription service where you receive unreleased microgames, promo cards, expansion content, a micro newsletter with industry interviews, and big Kickstarter discounts.... every month. Supporters will receive from $1, $2, $5 to $10 off of EVERY GAME. Details here: http://patreon.com/buttonshy

campaign.story:
From the creators of the bestselling game, Paperback, comes the next chapter in deckbuilding / word games - Hardback. As an aspiring, 19th-century author, you work to write your next novel, earning money and prestige along the way. Spend your coin on new, more powerful cards to improve your deck and write ever better novels. Be the first to acquire enough prestige to complete your masterpiece and be recognized as the finest novelist of the age!
Play as Penelope Quill - Paige Turner's great-grandmother, writing novels in the 1800s
All new illustrations from artist Ryan Goldsberry brilliantly capture the era - with some clever twists
Wordsmiths can score big by discovering the perfect word from their hand of randomly drawn cards
Strategic players can maximize the benefit of their cards by carefully crafting the perfect deck
Hardback is for 2-4 players age 10 and up, and takes roughly 45-60 minutes to play
      Hardback is the follow-up to Paperback, the award-winning word / deckbuilding game from Tim Fowers. Hardback is not an expansion - it's a whole new game. Fans of Paperback will feel right at home playing Hardback, though there are plenty of new strategies and mechanics to explore:
Hardback has no dedicated wild cards - your starting hand offers significantly more variety - and you'll never draw a "worthless" hand
Any card can be made wild by playing it face-down - keeping you in control of which cards to focus on
In Hardback, you do not purchase cards to earn victory - instead, play letter cards that score victory each time they are used
Hardback does not have a pre-configured offer row - setting up a new game is as quick as shuffle and go
No "draw extra cards" cards - instead, use "ink" to press your luck and draw extra cards - but go too far and you might not be able to spell a word
Persistent cards provide stay in play and provide benefit each turn - until your opponents force you to discard them by using your letter in their word
In hardback, there are four distinct card "genres", each with their own unique mechanics to compliment your play style:
        "Hardback has some really intriguing plot twists that I didn't see coming... I'm really enjoying it." - Jonathan Liu, GeekDad
"Hardback is a great companion game to Paperback. The genre synergies let you focus your deck, ink lets you push your luck for potential big scores (and helps you use up spare coin,) and the persistent cards create a lot of combo opportunity. Hardback will easily rise up my lists of favorite word and favorite deck building games." - Suzanne, The Dice Tower @425suzanne  
"Tim Fowers has done it again. Hardback continues the work that Paperback started: combining smart mechanics with a well-known genre to create a game that is really quite satisfying as well as incredibly accessible." - Gameocity
"I really enjoyed this game... if you enjoyed Paperback, this is like the next level. I think you'll really enjoy Hardback." - Kevin & Melissa, Tantrum House
"I found it to be a great mish-mash of different genres and felt that the deck-building, word spelling, and push-your-luck mechanics worked well together... this one was incredibly fun." - Vincent Paone, Dad's Gaming Addiction
"The push-your-luck element is always great (even more so if you can get remover), the art's awesome, and I love the genre synergies" -  Eric, What's Eric Playing @whatseplaying
Rahdo Runs Through It Gameplay Videos and Final Thoughts:
         For a quick rundown of the rules, checkout the videos below. For a deeper dive, take a look at the game rules.  Thanks to Sam Says Reviews! check him out on Youtube and Facebook
    "The PYL 'ink' mechanism alone makes Hardback a must-have for Paperback lovers." - Kathryn, Backer 2685
"I was excited for the game but hesitant that it wouldn’t stand up to Paperback. I’m willing to say that this game is even better than its predecessor. Fans will find it refreshingly different… enough that they will still be able to play both games." - Jessica, Backer 96
"We enjoyed it as it was - both of us employed different strategies and we ended up with a really close game" - Garry, Backer 881
"Overall though we liked it considerably more than Paperback" - Roy, Backer 351  
If you're interested in trying Print and Play, sign up here: Print and Play Survey
We'll be featuring quotes from some PnP players, so request your copy today and let us know what you think!
"Hardback takes the simple concepts from Paperback, and transforms them into a richer experience. Fans of the original should definitely check this one out." - Icarus599

PLAY

  Cosmic Run: Rapid Fire is a quick and fun dice game designed by Steve Finn of Dr. Finn's Games for 1-2 players, which plays in 15-20 minutes. As with Cosmic Run, its predecessor, Cosmic Run: Rapid Fire takes place in the future, after planet earth has been abandoned and the remaining humans are divided into 2 opposing factions.
The game is a "roll and write" game in which players roll dice and write on their tracking sheets. Cosmic Run: Rapid Fire is a more aggressive game than Cosmic Run because players not only race each other, but are often directly attacking each other (though there is a "friendly" variant that softens the game a little).  Furthermore, a hostile alien race places space mines on the paths to planets, posing further problems for humans.
Download the draft rulebook.
Note: The scoring sheets are double-sided, with one side posing a greater challenge for both players. 
Here's a video tutorial for a quick understanding of the game.  For an in-depth look, watch the review videos down below.
The illustrations were done by Lawrence van der Merwe, the artist for the original Cosmic Run. The graphic design and the promotional video were done by Sebas and Rocio, respectively, from OK Art Studio. If you want to know more about them, visit: www.okartstudio.com.
The game includes rules for solo play and it has multiple variants to enhance replayability. There's a "friendly" variant for those who want less conflict and a "rapid fire" variant for those who want an even quicker game. Furthermore, the tracking sheets are double-sided with more challenging planet tracks on the B-side.
Here's a video play thorough of the solo mode by Dr. Finn.
What about a 3 or 4 player variant? 
Eventually, I hope to post a 3-4 player variant for this game, but the reason I did not include this variant  is because a 3 or 4 player game will really slow it down. I do not want to make a game for 1-4 players that shines for 1 or 2 players, but bogs down at 3 or 4. In short, I do not want to compromise the mechanics and quality of a game to force it to accommodate higher player counts. That said, I  hope to be able to come up with something decent, but it may turn a quick filler game into a longer game that might outstay its welcome to many players.  It will take some time for me to develop and I cannot promise a great result.  I can say, however, that the game for 1-2 players is pretty darn good.
Kickstarter backers receive a special TechTools promotional pack that includes 3 "TechTools" + 1 instruction card.  This pack will only be available during Kickstarter campaigns  (though the retail backers of this project will also be given a small number of packs). 
  Get a fun game by a highly regarded game designer.  All of Dr. Finn's games continue to receive glowing reviews from members of the board gaming community. 
Own a great game to play with gamers and non-gamers.  Dr. Finn is well known for designing easy to learn games that appeal to all levels of game players.

Shipping to European Union: All games going to non-U.S. destinations will ship from the U.K., which means E.U. backers will not be subject to additional taxes or duties. You will receive a notice when games ship from Games Quest. No tracking information is provided. Promo packs will ship from the U.S. and so may be subject to duties.
Shipping to all other destinations (including Canada): Games will ship from the U.K. All items may be subject to duties and taxes imposed by your country's customs office. You will receive a notice when games ship from Games Quest. No tracking information is provided. Promo packs, however, will be shipped from the U.S. and may also be subject to duties.
Costs: The listed shipping costs for those outside the U.S. are lower than the actual shipping costs because Dr. Finn's Games has reduced your shipping costs by incorporating some of those costs into the prices of the games.
Kickstarter backers have a wide variety of opinions about the purpose of crowdfunding. My own view is that Kickstarter's greatest strength is to help the "little guy or gal" bring something fun, creative, and good into existence, something that would otherwise be left aside. Dr. Finn's Games is a very small company that relies heavily on Kickstarter campaigns to stay in business. My goal is to make sure that backers are pleased with the campaign from start to finish. So, I maintain a good level of contact, with an appropriate amount of updates throughout the process, and I invite backers to contact me directly. I do my best to listen and respond.  I've had 10 successful campaigns, almost all of which were completed right on time. The only late project was late by a month. I also try to ensure that my backers are getting the best deal on the game (at least for the first 6 months from release). Since my games are not distributed, you will not find them for sale at on online retailer at 40% off a week after they hit the market (or even months after).  Of course, as a game gets older, I often have to sell the remaining copies I have at a discount, but that's usually far down the road. 
Let me mention my stretch goal philosophy.  I design my games to be whole without needing additional components.  I think it is disingenuous to withhold components that are already designed and part of the game, but only get added when a stretch goal is reached.  I am not going to do this, even though it is probably against my financial interests since it seems to be a popular thing to do.  My primary use of stretch goals is to improve the quality of the components, because I believe backers should be rewarded for helping the project reach higher funding goals.  
My promotional pack philosophy is also a part of this.  I want to reward Kickstarter backers with access to something special, so I do offer promotional packs that usually just add a little variant to the game, rather than a full expansion.  I frequently get requests outside of Kickstarter campaigns for access to the packs, but I do not sell them.
  Boardgamegeek.com is the best place to do research on Dr. Finn's Games. Click on the name to go to the BGG page: Biblios, Biblios Dice, Butterfly Garden, Capo dei Capi, Cosmic Run, Foragers, Herbaceous, The Institute for Magical Arts, Let Them Eat Shrimp, Slush Fund 2. campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Please read carefully before backing this project.

PRIOR KICKSTARTER PROJECTS 
All prior Kickstarter campaigns for Dr. Finn's Games have been completed, with the exception of C.O.G., which is still in production and on time.


PRODUCTION RISKS 
Game manufacturing and publishing contains a number of risks. For this project, the greatest risks follow from the fact that the games will be manufactured in China and shipped to the U.S. The most serious threat in this regard concerns quality control over the manufacturing. A more likely threat, though less serious, is the possible delays involved. Dr. Finn's can mitigate both of these concerns. First, I will be using a manufacturer who has produced good results on game projects in the past. Second, I have successfully completed almost all of my Kickstarter campaigns right on time or even early (only 1 project was a few weeks late). If any delays do unexpectedly occur, backers will be notified promptly.

MISSING/DAMAGED ITEMS 
If you receive any games that are missing items, please contact me at doctorfinns@gmail.com and replacements will be promptly shipped. If the game arrives damaged, you'll receive replacements for whatever is damaged. Please send along a picture, as I may be able to get reimbursed from the shipper. For the past few projects (after switching manufacturers and shipping companies), we've had a very low defect rate (less than 1%).

REFUNDS 
Refunds are not usually given, unless there is a failure to deliver the games you've requested. However, if you are completely unsatisfied with any game, please contact me and we can discuss it.

DELIVERY DATE 
Unlike many Kickstarter campaigns, Dr. Finn's Games has a great track record of being on time. Cosmic Run: Rapid Fire is scheduled to be delivered by September 2017. Unless otherwise noted, all other items will ship with Cosmic Run: Rapid Fire at the same time.

UNDELIVERED ITEMS 
If you provide an incorrect address or fail to update your address and a game is returned, it would be nice of you to pay for the re-shipment. However, I have paid for it in the past, though I think it really should be your responsibility.

SHIPPING 
Please read the shipping section above.

UPDATES 
Through this campaign you may receive updates on Dr. Finn's Games' other projects. However, such updates will be infrequent.

By backing this project, you acknowledge and accept the risks and challenges just stated.

Thanks! 
Dr. Finn's Games

updates.update_content:
Hello super people,
Thanks again for your support for Cosmic Run: Rapid Fire a couple years ago. I hope you've been enjoying the game. Many of you may already know this, but just in case, I wanted to let you know that I've just launched a Kickstarter campaign for School of Sorcery, which is a revised version of my earlier Institute for Magical Arts.  It's a 2-player, card and dice game.  If you have a moment to check it out, please do so and consider backing. As always, I rely on individuals like you to bring my games into the world.  We are on day 2 of a 14-day campaign and about 75% of the way there.  I could once again use your help.

Hello backers of Cosmic Run: Rapid Fire,
Thanks again for backing my project a couple years ago.  I hope you've been enjoying the game.   This is just a quick message to let you know that a promo pack for Cosmic Run: Rapid Fire is now available only Kickstarter (along with a new Cosmic Run card game).  The Rapid Fire Mission Pack consists of 10 cards (+2 instruction cards) that add a whole new twist to the game by giving you missions to accomplish during the game.

updates.update_userinfo: Next Stop -- Cosmic Run: Mining Colony
updates.update_content:
Hello friends of Dr Finn's Games and backers Cosmic Run: Rapid Fire,
I hope you've been enjoying Cosmic Run: Rapid Fire. This is just a quick note to let you know, if you are not aware, that there is a new game in the Cosmic Run series:  Cosmic Run: Mining Colony and it's live now on Kickstarter.  Like Rapid Fire, Mining Colony is a 1-2 player game.  The solo version is quite challenging!
In Cosmic Run: Rapid Fire, you raced toward a new home and, in Cosmic Run: Mining Colony, you've found one.  However, the planet is habitable but lacks many resources, so you must establish a mining colony on a nearby world that is rich with resources but poor in human comforts.  The game is a typical Dr Finn's Games design with quick and easy play, yet brimming with interesting decisions.

updates.update_userinfo: Rapid Fire: Almost Complete and Other Info
updates.update_content:
Hi all,
Thanks again for backing Cosmic Run: Rapid Fire.  At this point, I'm getting close to posting the final update (this is probably the penultimate one).  A few things to note:
International Backers
Thanks to everyone for their patience.  By Monday or Tuesday of next week, everyone should have received their games.  Many of you did not receive a shipping notice and I'm following up with Games Quest to see if they can figure out the problem.  The last remaining orders should be arriving to you very soon.  If you do not receive it by Tuesday, please EMAIL me at doctorfinns@gmail.com and I'll follow up.

Hi all,
A quick note to let everyone know that rewards to all backers have been shipped, including those outside the U.S.  You should have received a shipping notice from either Games Quest (outside the U.S.), Amazon (in US), or USPS (in US).  If you have not, please wait another day or two.
Feel free to contact me next week if you have not received a shipping notice.  The games may still take up to 3 weeks to arrive to you, depending on your location.

Hi all,
A quick update on Cosmic Run: Rapid Fire.
Sorry for Delay for International Backers
I've been informed by Games Quest that they are starting orders this week and should be done by Friday. Sorry for the delay.  They ran into an unexpected problem unrelated to this project.

Hi backers of Cosmic Run: Rapid Fire,
I know you've been getting a lot of messages from me, but I like to keep people updated on the shipping.
U.S. Backer Info
For U.S. backers, about 90% of the fulfillment orders have been placed with Amazon. This means a lot of you will be getting your rewards soon, if you have not gotten them already.  For those 10% who'll need to wait a little longer, I'll explain the issue briefly. When I send games to Amazon, I send a lot of games. In this case, over 600 games (including my other games).  When they receive them, they are not immediately available to me to send to you. Instead, they use some algorithms, I believe, to figure out how to distribute them to their different warehouses, so they get split up and moved around by Amazon.  In the meantime, they'll tell me how many of the games are available.  When a large number are ready, that is when I start placing orders with Amazon.  However, of those 600 games, about 50 are still being processed and moved around and I cannot do anything about it.  In a few days, I suspect it will all be done.

Gamer Deck is a series of card decks that appeal to gamers and game designers. Each deck will be more like a card system than a standard deck of cards. A card system has multiple elements to be used to play and design many games.
The plan is to develop new decks that have a theme related to games and game design. Here are some ideas for other decks:
(Game Designers, Graphic Designers, Artists, Game Names. Characters, Colors, Terms, Scenarios, Locations)

  Pride is card system similar to a standard poker deck. It's has 4 suits (clubs, diamonds, hearts, spades) and 52 cards plus 2 jokers. The face cards have no pictures, they are like the numbered cards but with a letter. What makes pride different is each numbered card is a different color of the rainbow. Each card is also completely unique. There is a different US state on every card and each card has a die.
              It is a card deck system. A system can be used to play many different games, like poker cards. I will be revealing and designing games that can be played with this particular deck. You can play a lot of your classic favorites like poker, go fish, rummy, memory, and many more. They will change because of the specifications of this deck but will still be fun.
This is not a kid's game. - But you can play kid's games with it.
            Ninja Bowling Rules!
Set up: Pick a color. Set up the bowling pin cards in a triangle like shown. Put your strike/spare cards off to the side. Hold your star cards in your hand.
Play: Each player throws a card at their pins to see who goes first. Whoever is touching the most cards gets to go first. If there is a tie, keep throwing to someone gets more.
You take turns throwing your cards. Your hand can not go past the front pin of the pins in front of you. The winner of the previous round goes first. If you get a spare (win a round), then win another round. That spare becomes a strike, just flip it over.
Scoring: Each round each player throws 3 star cards. Whoever touches the most combined cards wins a spare. If the player touches all the cards over the course of the 3 throws, they will get a strike card. First person to get 3 strike cards wins. All ties void each other out for each round.
Alternative idea. If you want to add a new challenge use the numbers on the back of the cards (1-6) to score points. You get points for the cards you land on. You can play to a predetermined score. Or you can't win unless you have more points than your opponent.
M80
  Risks and challenges
The challenge is completing the project on time. The estimated delivery time is an estimate. The project Pride was late because I spent 300 unexpected hours making it perfect. i even had a printing error and demanded to reprint it, even though the mistake was minor. I care about quality. I will do what I can to make the best product I can.
For Gamer Deck, I will print immediately so there shouldn't be any time issues. I selected September delivery just in case, but I expect to deliver it earlier.

updates.update_content:
Manufacturing is a very unpredictable business. The cards are printed and they look great. The factory made the tuck boxes with a coating that made the box too tight. They were nice enough to print again. It doesn’t take long, but an unexpected delay none the less. I expect everything delivered to my office in less than a week. I really wanted to get to you by Christmas, it will be close.
I hope you guys understand the trials and tribulations of making a game. As a one man show at the moment I can’t even explain the work that goes into a project like this. I do love you all for the support.

Those of you who are interested in manufacturing, I will explain why it has been taken me so long to print. I was going to use the original printer so both decks were identical, but I was not happy enough with the product. Those who have some of my earlier games, know I really appreciate high quality. I was going to use the manufacturer I used for Monster Deck 55 and Pride Deck, but the price went up and there are longer waiting times and shipping issues. It is different than it was three years ago.
I recently was hired by a board game manufacturer. I am just learning the business now. We don't specialize in playing cards. There is monopoly on the certain paper used for high quality playing card paper in Taiwan. So if we were to print high end poker cards, we would send out for it. I wasn't going to do this, but because of price and timing with the manufacturer in China, I will print with a new place again.

Please forgive me, life has been a bit overwhelming lately.
I do have good news.
My surgery went well and I am fixed. I feel like a new man.
My dad just had his 6th round of Chemo and the cancer might be gone.

Also, I have been hired to work for a board game manufacturer. It just happened. So things are really going to change for me. It is really important to take care of all my backers. Part of job will be helping others run kickstarters. If I can't run them myself , how can I help others. I will make things right. When I estimated delivery I was unaware so many things would go wrong. All I can do is keep at it. You will see things turn around from here.

All surveys have been sent out.

I will let you know when decks will be mailed.
Thank You all so much.

I will be sending out surveys this week.
I will be printing in July. Sorry for the delay, as you know I have a medical issue. I will have surgery on Aug 2nd. I will get decks delivered as soon as I can.

Thank You.
Hack

Hello all.
I did go to Japan, I did find help for Japanese rules, but The retailer I thought would buy a few hundred games said no unless there is a demand. Not that my game is bad, it's just how they do it now.
While I was in Japan I also saw a doctor, I have to have stomach surgery. If I told you the real reason I am behind schedule you would feel sorry for me, but I didn't want that. I am a tough guy. The condition I have causes me to throw up 30-40 times a day. I have been doing that for about three years. I have seen 4 doctors in 3 countries. The one is Japan is the best. Everything should be fine.

campaign.story:
Shortly after completing development of Tramways the base game, it immediately became very clear that expansions could provide a lot of fresh play, set in various cities, because many cities of the world need a tramway, as a matter of fact!
Thus, I present to you… the Paris / New York City expansion!
If you are unfamiliar with Tramways, do not despair! This is a perfect time to hop aboard. Just take a look at the Tramways section a little further down this page. 
For everyone else already familiar with Tramways, read on, and I will tell you everything you need to know!
Tramways: Paris / New York City includes one large, 42cm × 60cm, 2-sided gameboard, folded into 4 sections, with a map of the Paris of the 1920s on one side, and a map of New York on the other side. It also includes a A4 rulesheet that explains the rules differences, and the peculiarities of each map.
Both maps have very special characteristics, and feature some traversable waterways. In Paris, you will have to make the best use of the river Seine, because not only can you build bridges across it, your passengers can ride along the Seine in tourist riverboats — Tramways is no longer only about the trams! In New York, you will need to cross the East River in order to access the most profitable and rentable areas of the city. This is going to require constructing some expensive bridges….
Both maps are illustrated by Todd Sanders, and these new maps will help highlight the depth of the game, while simulating construction in these two legendary cities, each with its own characteristics. I created these maps to recreate the time period and the geographical situation of these two metropolises in the early 1900s. I hope you will enjoy not only revisiting the game Tramways, but also riding the tramways through these two great cities at the turn of the prior century….
Paris is Paris! This expansion prioritizes leisure buildings, and highlights the role of the river Seine by allowing passengers to be moved via the famous tourist riverboats….
Tramways Paris Map
MAP Special rules: (3p-5p)
- You start the game all of the Leisure building cards and tiles, but only one each of the other types. 
- You draft your four starting parcels from the 25 available, rather than deal them randomly. 
- A new mode of transportation is available: tourist riverboats. They circulate on the Seine, and allow you to move passengers between buildings built on its banks. You must spend 1 magnetic strip per stop along the river, but each such stop also earns you $5 from the bank. 
So, with a few tickets in hand, you can take a grand journey on the Seine for great profits!
NEW VARIANT: It is possible to play the Paris map with 2 players. Just play with the East side or the West side of the city !
New Yoork, Neeeeew Yooooooork (Frank Sinatra is singing)…. The city of New York is divided into different boroughs, some of which are separated by the East River. You will need to build bridges at the right places in order to reach the most profitable neighborhoods. Rail links with bridges are worth a lot of points at the end of the game, assuming you can finish them in time!
Special rules: (2p-4p)
- You draft your four starting parcels from the 25 available, rather than deal them randomly. 
- Your Build 2 Rail icon + Rail Worker icon Generic card is replaced with a Build 3 Rail icon + Rail Worker icon Generic card. 
- You can build bridges across the East River (but not the larger bodies of water); however, a Rail tile on water requires 3 Build Rail icons! 
- Each completed link with a bridge is worth an extra 3 happiness points at the end of the game! 
You will have to manage your stock of Rail tiles (and use your Build Rail icons) very wisely!  
  These 2 maps contain 25 parcels each, all in need of names. 
As a Venture Capitalist, you can buy a parcel and see your name on the gameboard every time you play! You will need to provide your parcel name immediately after the end of the campaign, so as not to delay manufacturing. 
Or naming your name near the Eiffel Tower along the Seine ?
Of course, the names are subject to my approval. You will neither get to choose the exact location of your parcel, nor the city in which your parcel will appear.
Tramways is a train game with a deckbuilding mechanism, some nasty bidding, and very clever management of the ticket cards in your hand. 
LAST NEWS: Tramways has been nominated for the Goblin Magnifico 17 in Italy !
 Want more info, click HERE
    For a more detailed explanation and a review of the game, you can watch this video by Richard Ham final thoughts (a.k.a. Rahdo): 
 You don't want to read the rules book, just listen this video from Heavy Cardboard !
Various citations from around the internet with regards to Tramways: 
“a phenomenal game that is the jewel in the designer's crown!” — S. Carey 
“The solitaire game is juicy and appetizing,” — N. Morse

campaign.story:
Vast: The Crystal Caverns takes you and your friends into the torchlight of a classic cave-crawling adventure, built on the concept of total asymmetry. Gone are days of the merry band of travelers fighting off evil. In Vast, you will become part of a new legend... Any part you wish!   
    Play as the daring Knight, the chaotic Goblin horde, the greedy Dragon, the cunning Thief, or even the Cave itself — powerful, brooding, and intent on crushing the living things that dare to disturb its gloomy depths. Each role has its own powers, pieces, and paths to victory … and there can only be one winner.
  The Knight must kill the Dragon. The Knight gains power by completing Sidequests and recovering lost Treasures. She can reset her abilities each turn.
The Goblins must kill the Knight. The Goblins builds three Tribes by playing a push-your-luck game. Then they move around the board trying to corner the Knight.
The Dragon must wake up and escape through the entrance. The Dragon starts out slow but wakes up as he steals Treasures, devours Goblins, and explores the Cave. He does this by playing cards to fuel various powers.
The Cave must fully expand and then collapse. The Cave does this by gaining Omens, placing Treasures to lure the other players into its depths, and placing tiles.
The Thief must steal treasures to buy his freedom. The Thief uses stealth and actions to take Treasures from the other players and the Cave. As he does this he must get them back to the entrance.
With a Cave constructed of tiles, and decks full of monsters, special abilities, and game-changing events, no two playthroughs will ever be the same. Vast is truly unlike any game you’ve ever played. 
            The Ghost
The spirit of a long-lost adventurer, cursed to haunt the Cave for eternity. Her only hope of finding peace is to collect the few lasting remnants of her mortal life scattered throughout the Cave, and draw enough strength from them to finally escape the curse.
The Ghost is an advanced role that works with any combinations of players and roles, or allows you to play with up to six players at once. She travels slowly through the Cave, but has telekinetic powers that allow her to manipulate other objects from a distance, and she can even temporarily possess other players to force them to do her bidding.
Moving Entrance
This stretch goal adds a miniature for the entrance to the set of miniatures. You can place this miniature on top of the Entrance tile to show its location clearly. The miniature will also come with a new rules variant, in which the Entrance tile can be destroyed like any other tile, making it move to a new place. 
The Ghoul
Corrupted by the Cave’s power and the last remnants of its humanity long gone, the Ghoul lives only to hunt. It relentlessly stalks and terrorizes the other roles, growing stronger with each battle.
The Ghoul is an additional player role that can be used with any combination of player number and roles.
Treasure Chest Miniatures
This stretch goal adds 12 Treasure Chest miniatures to the set of miniatures.
Bonus Cards
This stretch goal adds 6 bonus cards to the game for all pledge levels.
These cards will not be exclusive to this Kickstarter campaign. They will include the Treasure Trove and Silver Gauntlet promo cards. I will add a funding level for people who just want the cards and the ability to purchase addons.
Crystal Miniatures
This stretch goal adds 9 Crystal miniatures to the set of miniatures.
Nightmare Unicorn
The Nightmare Unicorn will run around the board attacking and teleporting until it brings the Cave down on you. Stop it while you can.
Though the Nightmare Unicorn was designed just for solo play, we are trying to adapt it so it can be played instead of the Dragon or automated with a mix of other roles.
This stretch goal also unlocks the option to pledge for a $30 bundle of all three role addons.

THANK YOU BACKERS!
First published in 2011, Omen: A Reign of War has become a favorite two player game of gamers across the globe, even with minimal print runs. The game was nominated for the 2012 Golden Geek for best 2 Player card game, and lauded by fans and reviewers for its simple and dynamic mechanics, myriad of combos, and gorgeous art.  5 years later, Small Box Games is proud to present the next game in the Omen world; Omen: Edge of the Aegean.    
Omen: Edge of the Aegean is a standalone, two player card game using the familiar mechanics, gameplay, theme, and setting as the original Omen.  New cards, new twists, and new ways to play Units; Omen: Edge of the Aegean offers a fresh take on familiar game play.  Aditya Ikranegara and Jason Benningfield are the illustrators behind the artwork of Omen.  
While Omen: Edge of the Aegean was designed to be a standalone game, veteran Omen fans can add these new cards to their copies of Omen: A Reign of War.
Omen: Edge of the Aegean contains the following:
This is a short, 12 day project. There are 3 different rewards available through this project:   
Reward 1: $5.00 - Print and Play files for Omen: Edge of the Aegean 
Reward 2: $10.00* - Just the cards for Omen: Edge of the Aegean (provide your own coins and storage) + The rulebook + The Print and Play Files + a clear vinyl/gold Omen sticker.
Reward 3: $15.00* - 1 copy of Omen: Edge of the Aegean + The Print and Play Files + a clear vinyl/gold Omen sticker.
*Domestic shipping is included in Rewards 2 and 3. Canadian and International backers will need to pledge extra for international shipping (the amount required is listed on each reward).  If you would like to back for multiple copies, please check the FAQ.
The contents for Omen: Edge of the Aegean will be of similar quality as the last printing of Omen: A Reign of War. Omega Edition.
  As half-god children of Zeus, you and your opponent are bent on ruling all of Greece. With the blessings of the gods, you'll wage war over 3 Cities to prove who is the more powerful warlord and clever tactician.  
Omen: Edge of the Aegean is played over a series of turns, and ends when all 3 Cities have been destroyed.  Each Citiy is comprised of 2 Reward cards.  Players spend coins to play Unit cards to these Cities, and once the Cities become War-Torn, they are resolved and the player with the most Strength gains 1 of the Reward cards (worth 2 points at the end of the game, or 1 point if the player uses the Reward's ability). 
The 4 Unit Types in Omen: Edge of the Aegean
You can see a full card gallery of all cards included in Omen: Edge of the Aegean here.
Omen's turn structure is broken into 4 Steps:  
WEALTH - You receive 3 Wealth Actions.  Each Wealth Action is used to draw a card or gain a coin.  However, if you spend all of your actions on the same resource, you receive a bonus resource!
SURGE - You spend your coins to play Unit cards to your side of the Cities.  Unit cards boost your Strength in the Cities, but also offer powerful abilities to boost your efforts or thwart your opponent's.
WAR - Any War-Torn Cities are resolved, and the player with the most Strength in a City gains 1 Reward card. (A City is War-Torn if the opposing player has 3 or more Units in the City and/or there are 5 or more Units in the City).
OFFERING - You can discard 1 card from your hand as an Offering to gain additional cards and/or coins.
You can view the full rules here.
Chad Swee's (imtylerdurden on BGG) How to play video:
 And here is Chad's review of Omen: Edge of the Aegean review:
Once the game ends, players score points for the Rewards they've earned, Keres they have Exalted, and Moirai they have in their hand.
Check out what Dan Thurot of Space-Biff! has to say about Omen: Edge of the Aegean here.
Here are Travis Morton's (Knukcles29 of Daytrip Gaming BGG blog) thoughts on Omen: Edge of the Aegean.
Omen: Edge of the Aegean is a card game of give and take, often times forcing players to give up one thing to earn another.  It is a game of calculated risk, combo driven card plays, and sometimes, a little push your luck.
Full Playthrough Video:
PLAY

  Some games will be won by focusing on Exalting Keres while snagging the occasional War victory.  Others will be won by flooding the Cities and burning through Reward cards. And some games will come down to who has the most Moirai in their hand at the end of the game. 
Already a Fan of Omen and want to know how to use these new cards with your existting copy of Omen?  Check out update #1!
Whether you’re a long time Small Box Games’ fan or this is the first time you’ve heard of my company, or Omen, thank you for taking the time to check out this project!   
Since 2007, I’ve run Small Box Games differently than most other game companies. The games I publish aren’t available from your FLGS or OLGS (unless they special order directly from Small Box Games, which doesn’t happen very often). With short run, domestically produced games, the majority of games that Small Box Games produces are distributed through Kickstarter projects like this one, and the rest are available directly from smallboxgames.com.
Thank you again for checking out (and hopefully backing) this project!
